title: National Parks signage fonts
content:
I'm working on a flier with a 1940s-50s National Park theme. Similar to the sign here:   
   
 [http://www.disneyphenom.com/site/California/GoldenState/GrizzlyPeak/camp/trackstrail/fire.html](http://web.archive.org/web/20071104020041/http:/www.disneyphenom.com/site/California/GoldenState/GrizzlyPeak/camp/trackstrail/fire.html)   
   
I'm also looking for any wood/stick/branch typefaces remniscent of this era. Fonts that would work well with Neuland... Can you help?

 [‹ (x) Winnie the Pooh font - Hunnypot (proprietary) {Paul (self)}](http://web.archive.org/web/20071104020041/http:/www.typophile.com/node/4507 "Go to previous forum topic") [(x) California license plate - Futura, Capone {Patricia, Mark S} ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20071104020041/http:/www.typophile.com/node/4514 "Go to next forum topic")
author: eternal_design

comments.content: Bob, I think this request has been asked for before. Try searching the archives.

Oh bugger... The "Fire hazard today" bit is Comic Sans.   
Yuck.   
   
As for "Red Wood Creek", that'll require some hunting.   
It has a distinct Art Deco/Frank Lloyd Wright feel to it.   
   
The tree log/stick fonts can be found with [Advanced Search](http://web.archive.org/web/20071104020041/http:/www.typophile.com/cgibin/search.pl).
